intro: Corydalis melanochlora var. pallescens, commonly known as the pale-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. This variety is noted for its delicate appearance and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. It is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
